item.name: Sutton Grange Winery
item.description: The 400ha Sutton Grange property is a horse training facility acquired in 1996 by Peter Sidwell, a Melbourne businessman with horse racing and breeding interests. A lunch visit to the property by long-term friends Alec Epis and Stuart Anderson led to the decision to plant syrah, merlot, cabernet sauvignon, viognier and sangiovese, and to the recruitment of French winemaker Gilles Lapalus, who just happens to be the partner of Stuarts daughter. The winery, built from WA limestone, was completed in 2001. Exports to the UK, Canada, Switzerland and Malaysia.
